definition[0]: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you
example[0]: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
example[1]: As the economy weakens, more and more jobs will be made redundant.
definition[1]: not necessary because something else means or does the same thing
definition[2]: if you are made redundant, you lose your job because your employer no longer has a job for you
example[3]: The bank expects to make 15,000 staff redundant over the next three years.
